msHeading.title: Confessionale
msHeading.note: The manuscript is a continuation of and bound with a Confessionale (Andreas de Escobar, Interrogationes et doctrine quibus quilibet sacerdos debet interrogare suum confitentem), printed in Rom in ab. 1495 (GW 7324).

physDesc.extent: ff. i + 25 (1-10 printed, the rest manuscript) + i9370mm.

collation.p: The collation is disturbed by the rebinding.

handDesc.p: Four hands. Hand 1: f. 10r-v; hand 2: ff. 11r-16v; hand 3: ff. 17r-21r; hand 4: ff. 21v-22v.

foliation.p: The manuscript is foliated by modern cataloguer in upper right corner.

acquisition.p: According to a note on the inside of the lower cover, the book was bought at Björck o. Börjesson in 1964.
